posts.post_content:
Before there were Level Up cards... there were flip cards!
  
   
Lavarunner is certainly fragile in his natural state, but if you get him flipped then he becomes an interesting enabler. Comparing him to [Furnace of Rath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Furnace of Rath) is a bit misleading - he is much closer to [Sulfuric Vapors](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sulfuric Vapors), except that he will include all red sources, rather than simply spells. If you want to make the most out of his ability, then, you're looking for cards that deal 1 damage to one or more players, since this little guy will be effectively doubling that without carrying as much of the inherent risk of the Furnace (to its caster). Some examples:
  
   
[Chandra Nalaar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chandra Nalaar)   
[Kumano, Master Yamabushi](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kumano, Master Yamabushi)   
[Goblin Bombardment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Bombardment)   
[Pyrohemia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyrohemia) (note: this will kill you too!)
  
[Sparkcaster](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sparkcaster)   
[Firecat Blitz](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Firecat Blitz)   
   
Remember - this will only enhance damage to players. It won't... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Some examples:

Pyrohemia (note: this will kill you too!)

posts.post_content:
Would be incredibly ridiculous for ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol), very powerful for ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol), and still worth using for ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) or ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)  
But for ![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) while still having a tiny 1/1 body, i'm not too content with this card.  
On the other hand, it might be interesting in a burn deck since you are rather able to manage keeping your opponent's side empty until this guy enters the field.  
On top of that, he also just needs to deal *any* damage, not combat damage only, making it useful with cards like [Fire Whip](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fire Whip) or [Viridian Longbow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Viridian Longbow).

On top of that, he also just needs to deal any damage, not combat damage only, making it useful with cards like Fire Whip or Viridian Longbow.

Posted By: Kryptnyt (8/1/2010 11:33:20 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The problem is his unflipped side is so trashy it makes [Raging Goblin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Raging Goblin) look amazing. That....just sucks.   
  
I could see it starting out as a 1 drop though, with a different flip trigger- 'whenever a creature dealt combat damage by (This Guy) dies, flip him.'  
  
He'd be a Raging Goblin most of the time, but a LEGENDARY Raging Goblin! Come On! =D
